title: Optional unwrapping failure OidcIdentityProvider at l. 223
body:
### Describe the bug

Hey team,

Recently encountered a weird bug in OIDC: a redirect loop is started because of an authentication failure on the stage of accepting the `code` from the IDP. 

Superficial debugging, has revealed that the loop occurs because of consistently thrown `AuthenticationFailedException`, which in turn is caused by internally-thrown `NoSuchElementException`. There seems to be a `Optional` unwrapping failure at line 223 in `OidcIdentityProvider`. I see that the method is `@Deprecated`, but it seems to be causing a bug anyway.

Supposedly, the problem has started when I added these 2 properties:
```text
quarkus.oidc.token.refresh-expired=true
quarkus.oidc.token.refresh-token-time-skew=5S
```

In the logs it's shown only as "Authentication failure: java.util.NoSuchElementException: No value present". Even if the described behavior is intended, the message looks cryptic, although it seems to be notifying of a misconfiguration (maybe?). 

These are the rest of the OIDC-related properties, let me know if you need more info:
```text
quarkus.oidc.enabled=${OIDC_ENABLE:true}
azure.tenant-id=...
quarkus.oidc.auth-server-url=https://login.microsoftonline.com/${azure.tenant-id}/v2.0
quarkus.oidc.application-type=web_app
quarkus.oidc.client-id=...
quarkus.oidc.credentials.secret=...
quarkus.oidc.authentication.scopes=offline_access
quarkus.oidc.token-state-manager.split-tokens=true
quarkus.oidc.token.refresh-expired=true
quarkus.oidc.token.refresh-token-time-skew=5S
quarkus.oidc.roles.role-claim-path=roles
```


### Expected behavior

Authentication proceeds OK.
